business.headline: India built UPI and Aadhaar, is it time for an Aatmanirbhar credit score too?A three-digit number may look small on paper. But for millions of Indians, it quietly decides how far they can go. India built digital infrastructure for identity (AADHAAR) and payment (UPI). The next question is whether credit deserves the same clarity and control.

Warner Bros Discovery signs $110 billion deal with Paramount SkydanceWarner Bros Discovery agreed to a $110 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance after Netflix declined to match the offer, creating a media powerhouse set to reshape Hollywood and streaming competition.

From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.
Sensex and Nifty erase early gains to end flat over global uncertaintyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 27.46 points to close at 82,248.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.05 points to end at 25,496.55.

entertainment.headline: Prabhas to Vijay Deverakonda: Is scale swallowing the soul in Telugu films? From pan-India stars like Prabhas and Allu Arjun  to local gods like Nani and Vijay Devarakonda, the obsession for scale and spectacle has made the traditional family entertainer a rare spectacle in Telugu cinema.

Jack White to Mark Ruffalo, Hollywood celebs react to US-Israel strikes on Iran Several Hollywood celebrities, including Jack White, John Cusack, Mark Ruffalo and Carrie Coon, reacted on social media to the US and Israel's military strikes on Iran.

Shefali Shah on gender roles: Being equal to men is not an agenda Shefali Shah called for equal parenting responsibility, stressing that fathers play a crucial role in shaping children's values and respect towards women.

Actor Vishnu Manchu shares missile visuals from Dubai: No child should hear war Vishnu Manchu shared a disturbing video of missiles lighting up the Dubai sky amid rising Middle East tensions. He revealed that the loud interceptions frightened his daughter.

Ali Fazal-Richa Chadha dial up chemistry with 'sleepover' talk, cute poses Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal delighted fans with a heartwarming social media exchange as Ali cheered her on for the first day of her new project.

The Kerala Story 2 box office Day 2: Film crosses Rs 5 crore after decent Saturday The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond saw a strong jump in box office collections on Day 2 after a delayed release, taking its total to Rs 5.40 crore.

Actor Sonal Chauhan appeals to PM Modi after being stranded in Dubai Indian citizens, including actor Sonal Chauhan and athlete PV Sindhu, are left stranded at Dubai airport following flight cancellations due to escalating tensions in the Middle East. Chauhan urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi for help.

Police file closure report in Vashu Bhagnani's FIR against Ali Abbas Zafar, others Mumbai police have filed a closure report in producer Vashu Bhagnani's FIR against director Ali Abbas Zafar, pertaining to their 2024 film, Bade Miyan Chote Miyan.

Rashmika-Vijay's pan-India wedding celebration plan: Annadanam, sweet distribution Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to mark their wedding by distributing sweets across major Indian cities and organising Annadanam at temples. Amidst their personal celebration, they wish to thank their supporters.
Toxic: New Tabaahi song poster hints at Yash-Kiara's quiet romance A fresh poster for the song Tabaahi, featuring Yash and Kiara Advani, has been unveiled. The song is set for release on March 2.

Protests disrupt The Kerala Story 2 screenings in parts of Kerala The release of The Kerala Story 2 ran into fresh trouble in Kerala as protests over its depiction of forced religious conversions led to disrupted shows and cancellations across several districts. The film hit theatres on February 27.

New viral pics: Rashmika's doli entry, Vijay's royal dagger steal spotlight Fresh pictures emerging from the wedding of actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have gone viral on social media in no time. Check them out here.

Dhanush, Vignesh Raja's Kara release date out. Check here Director Vignesh Raja's Kara, featuring Dhanush and Mamitha Baiju, will arrive in cinemas in April. Producer Ishari K Ganesh made the announcement during an event.

PM Modi wrote sweetest, thoughtful letters to Rashmika-Vijay's parents Actors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna looked back on their recent meetings with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, which took place just days before their private wedding ceremony in Udaipur.

The Kerala Story 2 review: One community, one villain, one agendaRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 The Kerala Story 2 expands the anxieties of its predecessor into something more fearsome and far more pointed. Is this a story about victims, or a narrative designed to shape how we see an entire community?

Rashmika-Vijay's wedding pics beat Virat Kohli's World Cup win post on Instagram Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have made Instagram history as their wedding pictures became the most-liked post by an Indian account. It surpassed the 24 million likes garnered by Virat Kohli's 2024 T20 World Cup winning post.

Keep fighting slowly: Anurag Kashyap to sister Anubhuti after Accused release Anurag Kashyap wrote a heartfelt note for sister Anubhuti Kashyap after the release of her directorial, Accused, urging her to "keep fighting slowly" despite mixed reviews.

Yash's Toxic builds buzz as makers announce trailer release date. See here The much-awaited trailer of Yash's upcoming film Toxic will be unveiled on March 8 in Bengaluru. Directed by National Award winner Geetu Mohandas, the stylish action drama will release on March 19.

Rajpal Yadav launches YouTube channel after release on bail, seeks fans' support Rajpal Yadav has launched his official YouTube channel shortly after being released on interim bail in a cheque-bounce case.

general news.headline: Live: Loud explosions in Tehran hours after Iran's fresh strikes on US, Israel basesUS-Israel's Iran Strikes Live Updates: Iran on Sunday confirmed that Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed at his office in US–Israeli strikes on Tehran, a development that marks a major escalation in the conflict that began on Saturday. The claim followed coordinated attacks by the US and Israel, with Israel saying the US-led operation — codenamed Epic Fury — involved pre-emptive strikes. US President Donald Trump confirmed a "major combat operation" as explosions were reported across Iran. Tehran, which vowed a "crushing" response to the strikes, targeted US bases across the Middle East, including in the UAE, Bahrain, Qatar and Jordan. Several countries in the region shut their airspace, while governments issued advisories urging citizens to stay indoors and avoid unnecessary movement. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Mob attacks US consulate with sticks, stones in Pak's Karachi over Khamenei's deathAuthorities used tear gas and imposed road closures as security forces prevented protesters from reaching the diplomatic mission.
Trump issues tit-for-tat warning for Iran, vows to use 'never seen before force'The warning came after the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps said that the murderers of Khamenei would be punished.

Khamenei's location identified, 30 bombs hit compound: How US, Israel struck IranIsraeli fighter jets reportedly dropped 30 bombs on a complex housing Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, following intelligence identifying a high-level leadership meeting.

Dubai airport, iconic Burj Al Arab hotel damaged in Iranian missile strikesOne of the terminals at the airport, normally one of the world's busiest aviation hubs, was damaged during an overnight Iranian attack that authorities publicly referred to only as an "incident."

Fresh blasts in Doha, Dubai as Iran vows most ferocious op against US, Israel basesExplosions were reported over Dubai and Doha for a second day as Iran launched retaliatory strikes targeting US-linked facilities across Gulf states following American and Israeli attacks on Iran.

17 killed in blast at Nagpur gunpowder factory; PM, Fadnavis announce aidSeventeen people died and 18 others were injured in an explosion at a gunpowder factory near Nagpur. PM Narendra Modi and Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced compensation of Rs 2 lakh and Rs 5 lakh respectively for the families of the victims.

West Indies, at home in Kolkata, stand between India and semifinalIND vs WI Preview, T20 World Cup: India are facing West Indies in a virtual knockout. Windies feel at home in Eden Gardens, having played two of their fixtures at the ground already. And they also have that one fond memory of 2016, where they beat England in the final of the tournament to clinch their second T20 World Cup.

Insurance mis-selling hits families. But regulators kept ignoring it for yearsIt has taken India decades to see the seriousness and scale of insurance mis-selling for what it is. We tell you the stories of some people who suffered because of it, and why the problem was allowed to go unchecked for so long.

Iran President, 2 others to lead transition after Khamenei's killingThe country will also look for the next Supreme Leader who will succeed Khamenei after his death. The responsibility will be bestowed on a body of clerics.

Khamenei's daughter, grandchild killed in US-Israel strikes: Iranian state mediaIsrael said nearly 200 fighter jets carried out what it described as the largest aerial mission in its history, striking about 500 targets across Iran, including strategic defence systems previously damaged in earlier attacks.

Loud blasts heard in Kabul amid clashes between Afghanistan, Pakistan forcesPakistan targeted multiple Afghan cities alleging militant safe havens, while the Taliban denied the claims and expressed willingness to resolve the crisis through dialogue. Both sides have reported casualties, though figures remain unverified.
24 Hours of conflict in west Asia: What is confirmed so farIndia Today's OSINT team answers the most-asked questions on the widening West Asia conflict, separating verified facts from speculation.

Who was Ali Khamenei, the cleric who held ultimate power in Iran since 1989?A central figure of post-revolution Iran, Khamenei oversaw military, judicial and foreign policy decisions while shaping Tehran's confrontational stance toward the West and expanding its regional influence.
Brigadier General Ahmad Vahidi appointed as IRGC's new Commander-in-Chief: ReportPrior to this, Vahidi served as the nation's Minister of Defence and Minister of Interior.

Travel chaos erupts as airlines cancel flights after US-Israel strikes on IranTravel chaos erupts as airlines cancel flights after US-Israel strikes on Iran, with Middle East airspace closures forcing widespread disruptions at Delhi IGI Airport and leaving thousands of passengers across South Asia stranded. Europe and gulf routes impacted as well.

When cricket took a backseat as cringe ads and influencers took overT20 World Cup: This is not about influencers versus journalists. It is about why access is being decided by follower count instead of understanding of the game.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Actor Vishnu Manchu shares missile visuals from Dubai: No child should hear warVishnu Manchu shared a disturbing video of missiles lighting up the Dubai sky amid rising Middle East tensions. He revealed that the loud interceptions frightened his daughter.

Iran targets 14 US bases, kills hundreds of troops, Washington denies claimThe first US base that Iran attacked was Bahrain, which was home to the US Fifth Naval Fleet. Several witnesses heard explosions and saw thick smoke.

Sam Altman says 'don't listen to old people': Trust AI or experience on career?Handcrafted ByOur Editors Artificial Intelligence is revolutionising how we learn, work, and make decisions by compressing decades of knowledge into seconds. But experts warn that AI cannot replace the power of human mentorship, judgment, and real-world experience, skills essential for ethical decision-making, effective leadership, and long-term career growth in today's AI-driven world.

Stranded PV Sindhu says explosion near Dubai airport, reveals frightening ordealStranded in Dubai, PV Sindhu revealed an explosion occurred near the airport where she was sheltering. The Olympic medallist described the moment as tense and frightening as she and her team await a safe return.

CBSE board exams in Middle East cancelled? Fake CBSE circular sparks panicAmid tensions in the Middle East, a viral circular claiming cancellation of CBSE Class 10 and 12 exams in the region has triggered confusion. The board has clarified on X that the notice is fake and said an official update will be issued separately.

India search for length as another high-scoring knockout looms in T20 World CupIND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: India held a relatively short but interesting practice session in Kolkata on Saturday, February 28. Jasprit Bumrah and Varun Chakravarthy trained separately under the watchful eyes of the team management.

sports.headline: When cricket took a backseat as cringe ads and influencers took over T20 World Cup: This is not about influencers versus journalists. It is about why access is being decided by follower count instead of understanding of the game.

England Lions vs Pakistan Shaheens called off amid UAE security concerns The ECB has cancelled the England Lions' second 50-over match in Abu Dhabi due to escalating security concerns in the Middle East. The situation has also delayed England Women's tour, although the senior men's team will continue with their T20 World Cup plans as scheduled

Don't make the Washington Sundar mistake: Ex-India cricketer wants unchanged XI vs WI T20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra warned India against tinkering with their Playing XI now. He stressed stability over experimentation ahead of the must-win clash vs West Indies

T20 World Cup: Akhtar, Ahmed slam 'clueless' Pakistan management after early exit Shoaib Akhtar and Ahmed Shehzad sharply criticised Pakistan's team management after T20 World Cup exit. Their comments highlight deep concerns over tactical errors and lack of progress in three years.

West Indies, at home in Kolkata, stand between India and semifinal IND vs WI Preview, T20 World Cup: India are facing West Indies in a virtual knockout. Windies feel at home in Eden Gardens, having played two of their fixtures at the ground already. And they also have that one fond memory of 2016, where they beat England in the final of the tournament to clinch their second T20 World Cup.

Sanath Jaysuriya to step down as Sri Lanka coach after forgetful T20 World Cup run? T20 World Cup: Sanath Jayasuriya hinted at stepping down after Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup exit but has not taken a final decision yet. The coach remains open to discussions with Sri Lanka Cricket before deciding his future.

Stranded PV Sindhu says explosion near Dubai airport, reveals frightening ordeal Stranded in Dubai, PV Sindhu revealed an explosion occurred near the airport where she was sheltering. The Olympic medallist described the moment as tense and frightening as she and her team await a safe return.

After T20 World Cup exit, Salman Agha admits Pakistan struggles dealing with pressure T20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan captain Salman Agha has admitted his side's poor decision-making under pressure cost them a semifinal spot, as they exited the T20 World Cup 2026 on net run rate.

IND vs WI Predicted XIs: Will Rinku Singh feature at Eden Gardens in race to semifinals? India and West Indies meet in a virtual quarterfinal at Eden Gardens on Sunday, with a semifinal spot against England the prize. Rinku Singh's return adds another layer to India's selection dilemma.

India search for length as another high-scoring knockout looms in T20 World Cup IND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: India held a relatively short but interesting practice session in Kolkata on Saturday, February 28. Jasprit Bumrah and Varun Chakravarthy trained separately under the watchful eyes of the team management.

Pakistan told to take decisive call on Babar Azam after T20 World Cup exitT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan were knocked out of the T20 World Cup despite beating Sri Lanka, as New Zealand advanced on a superior net run rate. Pujara has called for honest talks over Babar Azam's T20 future.

Darren 'David' Sammy calls upon West Indies to down 'Goliath' India at Eden GardensIND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026: West Indies play India in a battle of David vs Goliath on Sunday, March 1. Ahead of the virtual quarter-final, Sammy spoke openly about how he has tried to inspire his side with the stories of 2016.

Record hundred, but no joy: Sahibzada Farhan on T20 World Cup heartbreakSahibzada Farhan scored a record-breaking hundred against Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup 2026. Despite his efforts, Pakistan were eliminated from the tournament after failing to improve their net run rate.

NRR-error 404: Pak knocked out despite beating Sri Lanka, New Zealand in semisPAK vs SL, T20 World Cup Super 8: Sahibzada Farhan's record-breaking century was not enough to save Pakistan, as their narrow win over Sri Lanka left them short of the required run rate to leapfrog New Zealand into the semi-finals. Pakistan needed a victory margin of at least 65 runs, but managed only a five-run win despite posting 212 on the board on Saturday.

MS Dhoni arrives in Chennai, no morse code message on T-shirt this time: VideoIPL 2026: MS Dhoni arrived in Chennai on Saturday to join Chennai Super Kings' pre-season camp. Unlike last year, there was no message on the former captain's T-shirt upon his arrival. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad also landed in the city later in the evening.

PV Sindhu stranded at Dubai airport ahead of All England OpenStar Indian shuttler PV Sindhu is stranded at Dubai airport after US-Israel strikes on Iran suspended all flights, putting her All England Open campaign in doubt.

Ongoing US-Israel attacks on Iran leaves Mushfiqur Rahim stuck in JeddahBangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim is stranded in Jeddah after US-Israel strikes on Iran shut down Middle East airspace, grounding thousands of flights worldwide.

When J&K's Abdul Samad found redemption against familiar foes KarnatakaHaunted by a painful quarter-final exit at 18, Abdul Samad returned wiser and resolute, playing a pivotal role in Jammu and Kashmir's maiden Ranji Trophy triumph and personal redemption against Karnataka. He finished the season with 748 runs in 10 matches.

Pakistan's Sahibzada Farhan breaks Virat Kohli's all-time T20 World Cup recordT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan opener Sahibzada Farhan broke Virat Kohli's all-time record for most runs in a single edition of the T20 World Cup. The right-hander brought up his fourth fifty, leading Pakistan's push for a big total against Sri Lanka in their Super 8 match in Pallekele on Saturday.

ICC working on alternate flight plans after US-Israel's Iran strikesThe ICC has activated contingency plans to protect all involved in the T20 World Cup 2026 after Middle East conflict disrupted key Gulf travel routes. This move ensures the tournament proceeds smoothly while prioritising safety amid geopolitical tensions.

Bat like Sehwag: McCullum's message to Rehan Ahmed during NZ vs ENGRehan Ahmed revealed that Brendan McCullum told him via his walkie-talkie to bat like Virender Sehwag during the Super 8 clash against New Zealand. Rehan's cameo helped England secure the win against the Blackcaps.

Will Tilak Varma continue to bat at No 6 vs West Indies? Ryan Ten Doeschate answersIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate updates on Tilak Varma's batting role ahead of crucial West Indies clash. India need a win to progress in the T20 World Cup amid fierce competition and past challenges.

First high-pressure clash without Virat and Rohit. Is new-look India ready?T20 World Cup 2026, IND vs WI: Speaking to the press on the eve of their must-win Super 8 match against the West Indies, assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said the Indian players are looking to embrace the pressure of the big contest rather than trying to brush it under the carpet. India will play a high-pressure match in an ICC event for the first time since Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired from T20Is.

T20 World Cup: Pakistan drop Babar Azam for must-win clash vs Sri LankaT20 World Cup: With a spot in the semi-final on the line, Pakistan have decided to drop Babar Azam for the clash against Sri Lanka in Pallekele on Saturday, February 28.

From enablers to champions: Tendulkar leads tributes to J&K after Ranji Trophy winSachin Tendulkar led the way with praises as Jammu and Kashmir won their maiden Ranji Trophy title on Saturday, February 28. J&K secured their title win after drawing the final after securing a first innings lead.

PAK vs SL Highlights: Pakistan register 5-run victory but get knocked outPAK vs SL Highlights, T20 World Cup Super 8s: Pakistan have registered a thrilling five-run victory against Sri Lanka, despite Dasun Shanaka's herculean effort in the final over. However, Pakistan have been knocked out of the tournament.

Ranji Trophy: J&K CM announces Rs 2 crore reward, government jobs for winnersChief Minister Omar Abdullah has announced a Rs 2 crore cash reward and government job guarantees for the Jammu & Kashmir squad after they secured a historic maiden Ranji Trophy title. Abduallah was in Hubli to celebrate the team's success after they outclassed Karnataka in the final on Saturday.

Why BCCI president Manhas was hoisted by players after J&K's Ranji Trophy winJammu & Kashmir secured their first-ever Ranji Trophy title with a historic win over Karnataka. Mithun Manhas' vision and introduction of red-soil wickets played a crucial role in this transformation.

Ranji Trophy final: Auqib Nabi turns title dream into history for Jammu and KashmirAuqib Nabi started his cricketing journey with the dream of winning the Ranji Trophy one day. On Saturday, February 28, Nabi became the big game player that propelled J&K to their first-ever title with an impressive five-wicket haul.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
